title: Britain's Got Talent 2019, live semi-final 5, recap: no bloopers or storm-offs, just a reasonable amount of talent
text:
There were no f-bombs, bloopers or storm-offs on tonight's edition of the BGT semis, but there was a reasonable amount of talent on display...

X: the creepiest BGT act ever

Yep, even creepier than Susan Boyle. We didn’t know there was a gap in the market for a telepathic psychopath, but that’s essentially X’s vibe. Wearing a horror movie mask and speaking via a voice distorter, X wowed the audience and the judges with his modern take on magic, which included inflicting pain on Ant and Dec and faffing around with Instagram. It was more compelling than it sounds, but can an act as calculatedly scary and mysterious as this ever really connect with the British public? Well, apparently so - X topped...
description: There were no f-bombs, bloopers or storm-offs on tonight's edition of the BGT semis, but there was a reasonable amount of talent on display.
